titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alonzo Williams annotated German book collection, 1878-1895 RL.11070
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-10-22 13:47:07 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Alonzo Williams annotated German book collection
did.abstract: Collection comprises a collection of Alonzo Williams' annotated German texts. There are six titles annotated and interleaved in seven volumes, including Williams' edition of Faust; works by Schiller, including Maria Stuart, the Maid of Orleans, and William Tell; Karl Lachmann's Die Gedichte Walthers von der Vogelweide; and Gotthold Ephraim Lessing's Nathan der Weise.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Alonzo Williams, professor of Germanic languages and literature at Brown University, was born in Foster, Rhode Island, on September 14, 1842.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Alonzo Williams annotated German book collection, 1878-1895, was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1993.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alonzo Williams annotated German book collection, 1878-1895, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0105a.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a collection of Alonzo Williams' annotated German texts. There are six titles annotated and interleaved in seven volumes, including Williams' edition of Faust; works by Schiller, including Maria Stuart, the Maid of Orleans, and William Tell; Karl Lachmann's Die Gedichte Walthers von der Vogelweide; and Gotthold Ephraim Lessing's Nathan der Weise.

Lessing, Gotthold Ephraim, 1729-1781 -- Nathan der Weise
